descriptionProfile: Ami Vitale is a Nikon Ambassador and National Geographic photographer working on stories of Coexistence.
Ami Vitale is a Nikon Ambassador and National Geographic photographer working on stories of Coexistence.

posts.description:
Photo by @amivitale. A happy rhino takes a mud bath at Lewa Wildlife Conservancy on Northern Kenya @lewa_wildlife. Populations of the Eastern black rhino plummeted by 98% between 1960 and 1995 primarily as a result of poaching and hunting, according to the International Union for the Conservation of Nature. Conservation efforts have stabilized and increased numbers in most of the black rhino’s former ranges since then. Kenya’s population is projected to rise significantly in the near future, especially with growing partnerships between government, communities and conservation organizations. It is hoped that the new rhino sanctuary will benefit Kenya’s black rhino population.

@nrt_kenya @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @nature_africa @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. A rescued elephant calf at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) in Northern Kenya. Elephant calves are orphaned or abandoned as a result of a variety of instances that include  drought, human-wildlife conflict and natural mortality. The skilled keepers at Reteti were recruited from the local community and trained in care and rehabilitation of these elephants. They hope to return all the calves in their care to the nearby wild herds. @conservationorg @nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. Shorty the reticulated giraffe gives Ami a kiss at Sarara Camp (@sararacamp) in Northern Kenya. He is a young rescue — his mother died from drought — but he is doing well under the care of Sarara's dedicated wildlife keepers. One day he will be reunited with wild herd at the Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in the Mathews Range, also home to Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e). Please follow and come visit @sararacamp and @r.e.s.c.u.e to learn more about the incredible work they are doing.

Photo by @amivitale. Time a mudbath and a dusting for this baby elephant at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) in Northern Kenya. The mud and dust are essential to keep them cool and protect them from the Kenyan sun and heat. Reteti is part of the Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in the Mathews Range, home to Kenya's second-largest elephant population, and was established in response to demands from the local community who recognize wildlife as an opportunity to improve livelihoods. 
@sararacamp @nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @conservationorg @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @nature_africa @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #natgeolodges #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. The highly trained wildlife keepers at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) work to comfort rescued elephants who have been orphaned or abandoned by the wild herds that live near the Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in Northern Kenya. Elephant calves are orphaned or abandoned as a result of a variety of instances that include poaching, man made wells, drought, human-wildlife conflict and natural mortality. Reteti's goal is to rehabilitate these calves and return them to the wild herds. The keepers were recruited from the local community and are deeply devoted to caring for these animals. Currently, 12 rescued elephants are living at Reteti. 
@sararacamp @nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @ConservationOrg @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @nature_africa @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #natgeolodges #natureisspeaking #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. Elephants roam in the 850,000 acre Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in Northern Kenya, home to Sarara Camp (@sararacamp) and the Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e). Outside of the Maasai Mara National Reserve, the Namunyak contains higher populations of large mammals than any other landscape (protected or unprotected) in Kenya — including the second-largest elephant population in the country, with more than 6,300 individuals. Expanding community-driven conservation work helps protects wildlife for, not just from, people. 
@r.e.s.c.u.e @sararacamp @nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @nature_africa @ConservationOrg @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #natgeolodges #natureisspeaking #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale at @fieldmuseum These are the original specimens that Theodore and Kermit Roosevelt brought to the US in 1929. They are on display in Chicago at the incredible @fieldmuseum.  I am speaking tonight at 7 pm for @natgeo LIVE at the Goodman theatre and will talk about pandas!

Photo by @amivitale. A picnic lunch in the Mathews Range of Northern Kenya, home to Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) and Sarara Camp (@sararacamp). Elephant calves are usually dependent on their mothers' milk for up to 3-4 years, but they learn what vegetation to eat by watching their elders. The elephant keepers at Reteti were recruited from the local community and trained in care and rehabilitation of orphaned and abandoned elephants. Their goal is to return these elephants to their wild herds as soon as possible, but in the meantime they are learning and exploring their surroundings. 
@nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @nature_africa @ConservationOrg @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #natgeolodges #natureisspeaking #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. Wildlife keeper Naomi greets one of the 12 rescued elephant calves currently living at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e). The first community-owned and -run elephant sanctuary in Africa, Reteti sits on the Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in Northern Kenya. The highly trained keepers were recruited from the local community. They only take elephants into human care as a last resort, instead striving to rehabilitate and return lost calves to their wild herds. 
@nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @nature_africa @ConservationOrg @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #natgeolodges #natureisspeaking #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. Rescued elephant calves bonding at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e), part of the Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in the Mathews Range of Northern Kenya. Elephant calves are orphaned or abandoned resulting from a variety of instances that include poaching, man made wells, drought, human-wildlife conflict and natural mortality. Between 5 and 10 elephant calves are rescued in Northern Kenya annually, from a population estimated at 8,700. The trained staff at Reteti have proven to be especially skilled at returning calves to their wild herds. 
@nrt_kenya @lewa_wildlife @nature_africa @ConservationOrg @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @sandiegozoo @natgeo @natgeocreative @thephotosociety @nikonusa #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #natgeolodges #natureisspeaking #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond5s #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. Dorothy prepares a meal for the rescued elephant calves at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) in Northern Kenya. She is one of the dedicated wildlife keepers recruited from the local community who is working to rehabilitate and return these elephants to the wild herds. Reteti and nearby Sarara Camp (@sararacamp) are in the Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy, which is situated in the Mathews Range and was established in response to demands from the local community, who recognize wildlife as an opportunity to improve livelihoods.
